thread.title: FTSE 250 movers: Wizz shares take off, William Hill down after profits fall
thread.title_full: FTSE 250 movers: Wizz shares take off, William Hill down after profits fall

title: FTSE 250 movers: Wizz shares take off, William Hill down after profits fall
text:
1.90 0.00 
LONDON (ShareCast) - (ShareCast News) - London's FTSE 250 fell 0.52% to 17,6933 after US non-farm payrolls rose less than expected. 
The data showed US employers added 215,000 jobs, missing the consensus forecast of 225,000. 
In London, William Hill (Other OTC: WIMHF - news ) shares posted the largest decline, down 8% at 377.8p. The shares have taken a hammering after the company reported at 35% fall in pre-tax profit to £78.7m and flat net revenue for the six months to 1 July as it battled through a period of major regulatory and taxation disruption. 
Tax and gambling duty changes in the UK, namely the new Point of Consumption Tax (POCT) and increased Machine Games Duty (MGD) rate levelled an extra £44m hit on the business, dragging operating profits down 12% to £155.7m. 
The gambling group reported a 35% fall in pre-tax profit to £78.7m and flat net revenue for the six months to 1 July as it battled through a period of major regulatory and taxation disruption. 
Other major fallers included Evraz (LSE: EVR.L - news ) down 6% to 94.40p, NMC Health (LSE: NMC.L - news ) , 3.6% to 857.50p and Brown (N.) Group , 3.27% to 310.90p. 
Among the risers, Wizz Air (LSE: WIZZ.L - news ) rose 3.69% to 1,825.5p. The shares continue to benefit from strong passenger data on Tuesday showing numbers for July up 20% year on year. 
Miners were up as investors looked to cover their losses from the previous session. Petrofac (Amsterdam: PF6.AS - news ) rose 3.28% to 881.5p, Vedanta Resources (Other OTC: VDNRF - news ) 3.09% to 426.8, Premier Oil (LSE: PMO.L - news ) 2.92% to 123.2 and Tullow Oil (LSE: TLW.L - news ) 2.36% to 229.6p.
